intro: Erigeron karatavicus, commonly known as the Karatavsky fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky environments and has silver-green foliage with a fuzzy texture. Its flowers are small and white or pale blue, often appearing in clusters at the tips of the stems. Erigeron karatavicus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
